comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
**Audit PR Docs**: Drift risk — documents private method names that will change.

Source: `src/erk/cli/commands/exec/scripts/setup_impl_from_issue.py`

Risk: The names `create_branch()`, `checkout_branch()`, and `GraphiteBranchManager` are private/internal identifiers. Per the learned-docs standards, private `_underscore` methods must never appear in learned docs, and symbol names in prose should default to NOT being named. These names are volatile and go stale without obvious indication.

Consider replacing with: "After branch creation, the branch is explicitly checked out because the branch manager restores the original branch after tracking." (no symbol names)

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
Fixed in 4b65457e1: Replaced private method names (create_branch(), checkout_branch(), GraphiteBranchManager) with generic description per learned-docs standards.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-22 13:57 UTC_

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
**Audit PR Docs**: Inaccurate claim detected.

Claim: "GraphiteBranchManager restores the original branch after tracking"
Reality: The current `GraphiteBranchManager.create_branch()` docstring explicitly says "Does NOT checkout the branch - leaves the current branch unchanged." The method creates the branch via git and registers it with Graphite's `gt track`, but does not checkout the new branch or restore any previous branch. There is no branch restoration in the current implementation.

Source: `packages/erk-shared/src/erk_shared/gateway/branch_manager/graphite.py` (GraphiteBranchManager.create_branch, line 69-106)

Note: The existing drift-risk comment on this line suggests fixing to "the branch manager restores the original branch after tracking" — but this phrasing is itself inaccurate. The correct phrasing is: "After branch creation, the branch is not automatically checked out, so an explicit checkout call is required."

Suggested fix: Replace line 142 with: "**Important:** After `create_branch()`, explicit `checkout_branch()` is called because branch creation does not automatically check out the new branch."

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
Fixed in 17eef7d1a: Corrected the explanation. Branch creation does not checkout the new branch (per GraphiteBranchManager.create_branch docstring), so an explicit checkout is required. No private method names used in the prose.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-22 13:59 UTC_

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
**Audit PR Docs**: Inaccurate claim detected.

The section "Review PRs Do Not Block Implementation" (around line 558) remains in this file but describes a subsystem that was just removed by this PR. The section states: "If a plan has an associated review PR (from Phase 3), implementation can proceed regardless of the review PR's state" — but there is no longer a Phase 2b (Plan Review) or a `review_pr` metadata field. `review_pr_cleanup.py` was deleted in this PR.

Source: `src/erk/cli/commands/review_pr_cleanup.py` (deleted in this PR)

Suggested fix: Remove the "Review PRs Do Not Block Implementation" section from lifecycle.md (~lines 558-573) since the review PR subsystem no longer exists.

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
Removed the stale "Review PRs Do Not Block Implementation" section (lines 558-573) from lifecycle.md. Fixed in commit 4e3c20bd0.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-22 13:10 UTC_

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
**Audit PR Docs**: Inaccurate claim detected.

The flow diagram above (in the "Plan Save Workflow" section) still shows Option E "Save & Review" as a valid workflow option, but Option E was removed by this PR. The ASCII diagram shows a 5-branch flow including a box labeled "Save & Review (E)" which now leads to a dead section.

Claim: The flow diagram implies 5 options (A, B, C, D, E) exist.
Reality: Only 4 options remain after this PR removes Option E. The `exit_plan_mode_hook.py` no longer offers a Save & Review option.

Source: `src/erk/cli/commands/exec/scripts/exit_plan_mode_hook.py` (only offers options A-D)

Suggested fix: Update the flow diagram to remove the "Save & Review (E)" branch.

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
Removed Option E "Save & Review" branch from the flow diagram in workflow.md. Fixed in commit 4e3c20bd0.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-22 13:10 UTC_

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
**Audit PR Docs**: Inaccurate claim detected.

Claim: Line 61 still reads "When exiting plan mode, you have five options:"
Reality: Option E "Save and submit for review" was correctly removed from the flow diagram above, but the prose on line 61 was not updated. Only 4 options remain (A, B, C, D).

Source: `src/erk/cli/commands/exec/scripts/exit_plan_mode_hook.py` (GitHub backend offers 4 options)

Suggested fix: Change "five options" to "four options" on line 61.

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
Fixed in commit f7bb17c — changed "five options" to "four options" on line 61 to match the 4 remaining options (A, B, C, D).

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-22 13:42 UTC_

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: **Dignified Code Simplifier Review**: Default parameter values violate dignified-python standards - violates the CRITICAL rule 'No default parameter values'. Parameters with default values should be required keyword-only arguments. See [dignified-python standards](../../.claude/skills/dignified-python/)

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
Fixed in a551ab7: Removed default parameter value. Made exclude_pr_numbers a required keyword-only arg and updated all callers to pass it explicitly.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-22 12:59 UTC_

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: **Dignified Python**: Default parameter values are not allowed in function signatures - Use LBYL to check the parameter and branch on None instead.

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
Fixed in a551ab7: Removed default parameter value. Made exclude_pr_numbers a required keyword-only arg and updated all callers.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-22 13:00 UTC_

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: **Dignified Code Simplifier Review**: Default parameter values violate dignified-python standards - the parameter should be required (keyword-only) without a default value. Use LBYL pattern: check the parameter at call sites. See [dignified-python standards](../../.claude/skills/dignified-python/SKILL.md) - CRITICAL rule 'No default parameter values'

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body:
Removed default parameter value from exclude_pr_numbers. Updated all callers (plan/list_cmd.py, real.py) to pass explicit None. Fixed in commit 44331da61.

_Addressed via `/erk:pr-address` at 2026-02-22 13:11 UTC_
